Item ID6739

The dragon axe is the second strongest and fastest axe in the game after its direct upgrade, the crystal axe, and is tied with the 3rd age axe. It is 10% more efficient at chopping logs than the rune axe.[1]

Like all axes, it is both a weapon (requiring 60 Attack to wield) and a tool (requiring 61 Woodcutting to use). However, as long as the player has 60 Attack to wield the axe, the special attack can be used to woodcut with the axe starting at level 58.

 Attack bonuses
-2+38+32+0+0
 Defence bonuses

Success rates[edit | edit source]

The success rate for chopping a log, per tick, is approximately 375% that of the bronze axe, or 7.1% better than a rune axe.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Axe
Combat OptionsCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost

HackSlashAggressiveStrength and Hitpoints+3 Strength
SmashCrushAggressiveStrength and Hitpoints+3 Strength
BlockSlashDefensiveDefence and Hitpoints+3 Defence

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performs the dragon axe's special attack, Lumber Up.

The dragon axe has a special attack: Lumber Up, that provides a visible +3 boost to Woodcutting. This consumes 100% of the player's special attack energy, though it cannot be used without the 60 Attack required to wield the axe.

Using the special attack every 5 minutes increases experience rates by about 1%.

The special lasts at least two minutes, but no more than three minutes and decays three times. Using Preserve can increase the duration by 50%.

As long as the player has 60 Attack required to wield the axe, the special attack can be used to woodcut with the axe starting at level 58.

Note that this boost does not stack with other visible boosts. The former will take precedence if both are activated simultaneously. You can use the cape's boost roughly 2 times in the time it takes from Lumber Up's effect fading to your special attack energy replenishing to 100%.

Upgrading[edit | edit source]

A player uses a smouldering stone to create an infernal axe.

Players can combine a smouldering stone with a dragon axe to create an infernal axe, which requires 85 Firemaking (cannot be boosted) to do so. This process cannot be undone and the resultant axe cannot be traded. The infernal axe will grant the player a 1/3 chance to burn logs for Firemaking experience whilst cutting. The infernal axe will be able to burn 5,000 logs before degrading, requiring another smouldering stone or dragon axe to charge it.

Players can also create a crystal axe via a singing bowl by combining a dragon axe with 120 crystal shards and a crystal tool seed. This requires level 76 Smithing and Crafting, which can be boosted. If players cannot create it on their own, they can have Conwenna or Reese sing the crystal for them for an extra 60 crystal shards, for a total of 180.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
Date unknown

The special attack was renamed from Clobber.

11 September 2014
(update | poll)

Random event ents no longer spawn and axes can no longer be broken.

27 March 2014
(update | poll)

The special attack was changed to temporarily increase Woodcutting level by 3; previously, lowered the opponent's Defence and Magic by 10%.

{{External|rs=Dragon hatchet}}
{{Infobox Item
|name = Dragon axe
|image = [[File:Dragon axe.png]]
|release = [[7 November]] [[2005]]
|update = Waterbirth Island - deeper, darker, deadlier!
|aka = Daxe
|members = Yes

[[File:Dragon axe detail.png|left|140px]]
The '''dragon axe''' is the second strongest and fastest [[axe]] in the game after its direct upgrade, the [[crystal axe]], and is tied with the [[3rd age axe]]. It is 10% more efficient at chopping logs than the [[rune axe]].{{CiteNews|url=https://services.runescape.com/m=news/song-of-the-elves-poll-blog-i?oldschool=1|title=Song of the Elves Poll Blog I|newsdate=28 January 2019}}

Like all axes, it is both a [[weapon]] (requiring 60 [[Attack]] to wield) and a [[tool]] (requiring 61 [[Woodcutting]] to use). However, as long as the player has 60 Attack to wield the axe, the [[special attack]] can be used to woodcut with the axe starting at level 58.

}}

==Success rates==
The success rate for chopping a log, per [[tick]], is approximately 375% that of the [[bronze axe]], or 7.1% better than a [[rune axe]].

{{Skilling success chart|label=Dragon axe success chances|showbefore=yes

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Axe}}

==Special attack==
[[File:Lumber Up.gif|frame|A player performs the dragon axe's special attack, ''Lumber Up''.]]
The dragon axe has a [[special attack]]: ''Lumber Up,'' that provides a visible +3 boost to [[Woodcutting]]. This consumes 100% of the player's special attack energy, though it cannot be used without the 60 Attack required to wield the axe.

Using the special attack every 5 minutes increases experience rates by about 1%.

The special lasts at least two minutes, but no more than three minutes and decays three times. Using [[Preserve]] can increase the duration by 50%.

As long as the player has 60 Attack required to wield the axe, the special attack can be used to woodcut with the axe starting at level 58.

Note that this boost does not stack with other visible boosts. The former will take precedence if both are activated simultaneously. You can use the cape's boost roughly 2 times in the time it takes from Lumber Up's effect fading to your special attack energy replenishing to 100%.

==Products==
{{Uses material list|Dragon axe}}

==Upgrading==
[[File:Smouldering stone.gif|right|frame|A player uses a smouldering stone to create an infernal axe.]]
Players can combine a [[smouldering stone]] with a dragon axe to create an [[infernal axe]], which requires 85 [[Firemaking]] (cannot be boosted) to do so. This process '''cannot''' be undone and the resultant axe '''cannot''' be traded. The infernal axe will grant the player a 1/3 chance to burn logs for Firemaking experience whilst cutting. The infernal axe will be able to burn 5,000 logs before degrading, requiring another smouldering stone or dragon axe to charge it.

Players can also create a [[crystal axe]] via a [[singing bowl]] by combining a dragon axe with 120 [[crystal shard]]s and a [[crystal tool seed]]. This requires level 76 [[Smithing]] and [[Crafting]], which can be [[Temporary skill boost|boosted]]. If players cannot create it on their own, they can have [[Conwenna]] or [[Reese]] sing the crystal for them for an extra 60 crystal shards, for a total of 180.
